lead_paragraph: New England signed the free-agent linebacker Victor Hobson away from the Jets on Monday, bolstering its aging linebacker corps. Hobson, 28, spent all five of his seasons with the Jets, starting 58 games. He joins a linebacking group that had Tedy Bruschi, Mike Vrabel and Junior Seau as starters last season. Hobson, a second-round draft pick out of Michigan in 2003, started 14 games last year and had 62 tackles and 2 sacks. His best season was 2006, when he had 100 tackles, 6 sacks and an interception.
